TopicTitle: Separate angle snap and vertical snap

Articles.Content:
Title says it all. While vertical snap is great to have stock (it was one of my most used features from EditorExtensions), It should not be tied to angle snap. There are multitudes of times where I could use angle snap but not vertical and vice versa. So here is my suggestion:

When you press the angle snap button (or the X key), it displays the current icon it does now and does just angle snap. Press it again and it adds a horizontal line through it (or some other change to indicate vertical snapping). Now both snaps are active. Pressing it a third time returns the hexagon shape to a circle but the line remains, disabling angle snap but leaving vertical on. The fourth press would return it to no snapping at all. This adds no GUI elements, just some new icons, and makes everyone happy. Only possible objection I can think of is people complaining about pressing it multiple times, which would be pretty petty since you already have to do that for symmetry.

I like this idea.

Perhaps you could clear something up for me, though. Your post makes it sound like vertical angle snap is already implemented but tied to horizontal snap. As near as I can tell, it isn't implemented at all. When I turn on horizontal snap, vertical placement is still free.
